CdrDocCtl.DocTitle: Copy XML for Citation QC Report

CdrDoc.CdrDocXml:
<?xml version="1.0"?> <xsl:transform xmlns:xsl = "http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version = "1.0" xmlns:cdr = "cips.nci.nih.gov/cdr">
<xsl:include href = "cdr:name:Module: Vendor Filter Templates"/> <xsl:include href = "cdr:name:Module: Citation Formatting - NEW"/> <xsl:output method = "xml" omit-xml-declaration = "no"/>
<!-- Template to display the entire Citation document and adding a new element displaying the formatted output to be picked up by QC report. ========================================================================= --> <xsl:template match = "Citation"> <Citation> <xsl:apply-templates mode = "root"/>
<FormattedReference> <xsl:apply-templates select = "PubmedArticle | PDQCitation | ProtocolCitation"/> </FormattedReference> </Citation> </xsl:template>
<!-- Default template to copy all elements and attributes ======================================================= --> <xsl:template match = "@* | node()" mode = "root"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select = "@* | node()" mode = "root"/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template> </xsl:transform>
